title: NBA Daily Dunk - February 21, 2026
subtitle: Your daily dose of hoops action!

items.headline: Kawhi Leonard Exits Lakers Clash with Ankle Injury
items.summary: Clippers star Kawhi Leonard departed Friday night's thrilling 125-122 loss to the Lakers in the final 5:10 with an apparent ankle injury. Leonard had tallied 31 points before leaving the game.

items.headline: Doncic Dominates in Return from Hamstring Injury
items.summary: Luka Doncic made a spectacular return from a four-game hamstring absence, dropping 38 points and 11 assists to lead the Lakers to a 125-122 victory over the Clippers.

items.headline: Deni Avdija: All-Star Season Continues, Back Fully Healthy
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija, a 2026 NBA All-Star Reserve, is having a standout season, averaging 25.5 PPG, 7.2 RPG, and 6.7 APG. He confirmed his back is healthy and the Blazers are confident in their playoff push.

items.headline: SGA and Curry Face Extended Absences
items.summary: OKC's reigning MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is expected to miss at least another week with an abdominal strain, while Stephen Curry of the Warriors will be re-evaluated in 10 days for a right knee injury.

items.headline: Lakers Edge Clippers in Crosstown Thriller
items.summary: Luka Doncic's 38 points led the Lakers past the Clippers in a high-scoring rivalry game.

items.headline: Thunder Rout Nets Behind McCain's Season-High
items.summary: Jared McCain scored a season-high 21 points to power the Thunder over the Nets.

items.headline: Nuggets Dominate Blazers in Road Record-Setting Performance
items.summary: Nikola Jokic posted 32 points as the Nuggets set a franchise record for road points in a rout of the Trail Blazers.

items.headline: Wizards Sweep Pacers with Alondes Williams' Career Night
items.summary: Alondes Williams' career-high 25 points and 10 rebounds propelled the Wizards to a victory over the Pacers.

items.headline: Cavaliers Hold Off Hornets
items.summary: The Cavaliers secured a win against the Hornets in a competitive matchup.

items.headline: Bucks Handle Pelicans
items.summary: Despite Giannis' absence, the Bucks defeated the Pelicans.

items.headline: Magic vs. Suns
items.summary: The Orlando Magic face the Phoenix Suns tonight.

items.headline: 76ers vs. Pelicans
items.summary: The Philadelphia 76ers take on the New Orleans Pelicans.

items.headline: Luka Doncic Leads Lakers
items.statContext: Key to Lakers' win over Clippers.

items.headline: Jokic's Efficient Performance
items.statContext: Dominated in just 29.5 minutes against Portland.

items.headline: Deni Avdija's All-Around Game
items.statContext: Despite a tough loss, Avdija filled the stat sheet.

items.headline: Alondes Williams Career Night
items.statContext: Career-high marks in the Wizards' win.

items.headline: Jared McCain's Season-High
items.statContext: New acquisition delivered a strong scoring performance.

items.headline: Bennedict Mathurin's Impact
items.statContext: Another outstanding game for the recently acquired guard.

items.headline: Post-Trade Deadline Shake-Ups Reshape League Landscape
items.summary: With the February 5th trade deadline now passed, the league has seen significant movement. Notable deals included Trae Young to WAS, Anthony Davis to WAS, James Harden to CLE, and Jared McCain to OKC, creating new contender dynamics.

items.headline: Star Player Injury Updates: Leonard, SGA, Curry Sidelined
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard's ankle injury adds to a growing list of star ailments, including Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (abdominal strain, out 1+ week) and Stephen Curry (right knee, re-evaluation in 10 days). Joel Embiid, Damian Lillard, Devin Booker, and Giannis Antetokounmpo were also recently out.

items.headline: Pistons Lead Tight Eastern Conference Race
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons maintain their lead in the Eastern Conference standings at 41-13, followed closely by the Boston Celtics (36-19) and New York Knicks (35-21), with the Cleveland Cavaliers also at 35-21 and on a six-game winning streak.

items.headline: Thunder and Nuggets Pace Competitive Western Conference
items.summary: The Oklahoma City Thunder (42-14) continue to impress in the West, with the Denver Nuggets (35-20) also holding a strong position. The Lakers have improved to 5-2 since February 3rd, positioning themselves for a playoff push.
